carbonImpact: High Total Blocking Time means the client device CPU is extensively used during page load. Optimizing this value lowers the energy usage / CO2 emission of the client device.
Delivering smaller JavaScript payloads at the appropriate time will decrease the useless JavaScript parsing and decrease energy consumption / CO2 emission.
Lowering the time and workload of the CPU will decrease energy consumption / CO2 emission for client devices.
Long caching policies for static files decreases returning pageview transfer sizes and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices.
Delivering smaller JavaScript payloads at the appropriate time will decrease the useless JavaScript parsing and decrease energy consumption / CO2 emission.
Not delivering legacy code for modern browsers will cause carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices.
High LCP might mean your web page is intensive in terms of images or styling. Decreasing this time metric lowers the energy usage / CO2 emission of client devices.
Decreasing SI lowers the energy usage / CO2 emission of client devices.
When the CLS metric is high, the graphics processor of the client device uses additional energy, optimizing this index can lower energy usage / CO2 emission.

High response time might mean either the server is far from the client and without a CDN service, or there are intensive backend tasks, optimizing this value will decrease carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices.

Lazy loading images helps lower data transfer and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices. Additional not rendering offscreen images helps decrease energy consumption by client devices.
Minifying CSS lowers data transfer and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices.
Minifying JavaScript lowers data transfer and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices.
Tree-shaking unused CSS rules before deployment lowers data transfer and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client device.
Tree-shaking unused JavaScript rules before deployment lowers data transfer and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client device.
Optimizing images lowers data transfer and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices.
Text compression lowers data transfer and lowers carbon emission of servers transfering files to client devices.
Using responsive images can lower data transfer for different device screen resolutions.
Lower DOM size means lower data transfer and lower energy used / CO2 emitted during page rendering on client devices.
Page load time is affected by this audit, optimizing this index can lower energy usage / CO2 emission.
